titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Hines correspondence, 1781-1836
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letters to William and Samuel B. Hines of Virginia, pertaining to privateering, relations of the United States with England, the embargo, New England's opposition to the War of 1812, and the election of 1836. Among the correspondents are Richard Blow, Thomas Gholson, Edwin Gray, John Hamilton, and John Young Mason.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: William Hines correspondence, 1781-1836, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters to William and Samuel B. Hines of Virginia, pertaining to privateering, relations of the United States with England, the embargo, New England's opposition to the War of 1812, and the election of 1836. Among the correspondents are Richard Blow, Thomas Gholson, Edwin Gray, John Hamilton, and John Young Mason.
